dialogues.line: Here is where we enter the Mazerock.
dialogues.comment:
Theo announces, as you stand on the edge of a narrow and winding canyon,
which zig-zags away in multiple directions.#

You are not really listening.#
You feel something in the air, some kind of tension.#
Like something bad is going to happen.##

You look down at the multitude of shadows nestled between the rocks, and you shiver.#
You feel like going down there is the last thing you want to do right now.#
Math puts a hand on your shoulder. You hear Efeliah's voice:

dialogues.line: Yeah... is something about to happen?
We are not sure... but we should be ready for anything.
dialogues.comment: This exchange of thoughts between the three of you only takes a couple of seconds.

dialogues.line:
So guys, there's a million crevices, crevasses and tunnels down there.
Let's be canny about which way we go.#
I wish we had a map...# Smiurl, I'm counting on your legendary sense of direction.
dialogues.comment: At this, Smiurl lights up only faintly, and in turn looks at you for some reason, with a mixture of anxiety and hopefulness on his face.

dialogues.line: Isn't there really ANY other way?

dialogues.comment: You sigh, and resign to delve into the Mazerock, holding your sword at the ready.

nodes.text:
You slowly make your way among the rocks and stone debris.#
You carefully watch your step, your senses heightened,
feeling every steady-ish pebble and every loose grain of stone slipping away under your feet.#
You feel the temperature drop as you go deeper.# The sky gets smaller.#
The sounds around you shift, acquiring a more echoing quality.#

$c<<Well, at least it will be nice to be away from the unceasing glare of the sun for a while.
No wait,# that is not the Sun...# whatever!>>#

$CSuddenly, you hear a soft sound coming at you from behind one of the bends!#
Everybody freezes, as two oxengutters jump into view.#
You're unsure if you should feel sheer panic or a strange sense of confidence,
as your premonition manifests itself.#
You manage a glance at the others, and see they don't seem shocked or surprised. Just focused.
nodes.alttext:
You recognize this spot, this is where you first entered the Mazerock...
And where you defeated the first two oxengutters.

encounter.victoryMessage:
Well done. You have defeated the oxengutters.#
You realize you need a better name for these guys.
Let's call them oxies from now on...#

nodes.text: Two very similar gorges branch out in front of you, not considering the slope from where you entered.

choices.desc: You know the way: go straight to the exit.

nodes.text: You stop at a modest opening. Ahead lies a dark tunnel, while another gorge branches off to the right.

You carefully enter the tunnel, trying to make out any shapes in the darkness.
Smiurl's glints inconsistently dance around, and Corolla lights a torch.#

You don't have to walk for long when you see the light in front of you.#
As you step back into the open, you think this was maybe too easy,
and, as a matter of fact, that's when you are ambushed again.#

Another oxie is hoping to get its meal sorted out for the day.
A large, quite gross centipede creature with sharp-looking mouth-parts and extremities joins the fray too.
nodes.alttext: You've been here already, it's the spot where you fought the oxie and the centipede.

encounter.victoryMessage: You disposed of the local critters. You are both elated and mildly disgusted.#

nodes.text: You stand with in the middle of another narrow canyon. A tunnel entrance is behind you.
You take a break at another small opening. The gorge transitions into a tunnel. You either continue or go back.
Another fork in the path.

choices.desc: Enter the cramped canyon to the west.

nodes.text: It seems like a dead end. Only rock walls around you. Birds circle overhead.

You walk along the gorge, and suddenly you hear a rustling sound from above.#
Before you can react, a large bird of prey swoops down at you!#
Its talons are sharp and it looks hungry.#

You ready your weapons, and prepare to defend yourselves.
nodes.alttext: You are back at the spot where you fought the angry bird.

encounter.victoryMessage:
You have defeated the angry bird.#
You feel a bit sorry for it; you hope reinforcements aren't coming.
encounter.defeatMessage:
You lost.##
To a chonky, absolute unit of a birb.#

Guess what's left of you will see its nest soon.#

nodes.text: You find yourself at another fork in the path.
You find yourself at another fork in the path, with a tunnel entrance to the side.
You find yourself at another fork in the path, with a tunnel entrance in front of you.
You find yourself at another fork in the path, with a tunnel entrance to your back.
Time to choose again: three gorges and an opening to a tunnel intersect here.

You crawl into the tunnel. It is very cramped and the ceiling is low.#
You try not to hit your head, with limited success.##
And when you are in what seems like the darkest part of it, several critters start crawling around you.
nodes.alttext: This was the tiny tunnel with that pair of Croeggs.

encounter.victoryMessage:
What a mess you made.#
At least you won't have to clean up.

nodes.text:
You squeeze through the rocks and slowly continue like that for a few minutes.#
This is another of those cases where you question your life choices in general.#

At last, you step out in a small opening.# Only to realize it's a dead end.#
A pile of rocks and boulders piles up to the sky and beyond in front of you, barring any progress.#
But you won't be allowed to just leave, some Oxies are pouncing down, not believing their luck.
nodes.alttext: This was that dead end where you met a few Oxies.

encounter.victoryMessage:
You slayed.# The beasts,# I mean.#
Time to head back.
encounter.defeatMessage:
You lost.##
These oxies were too strong for you.#

Fun fact: Oxengutters are opportunistic feeders, a bit like cats.#
And they don't mind some good old scavenging either.

nodes.text:
You find yourself at another fork in the path.#
A total of three gorges.#
You wonder, should you call it a Threek then.#
Who knows.

Befuddled, and betrayed, by the path, once more.#
A dead end.# Turn back.
You land in another opening. From behind every corner in the path: in front, behind and to your right, Oxies leap at you.
nodes.alttext: You've been here already, it should be the spot where the Oxies came at you from three sides.

encounter.victoryMessage:
You survived once more.#
Time to move on.
encounter.defeatMessage:
You lost.##
These oxies were too strong for you.

nodes.text: Again, you need to pick between 3 alternatives.
A bend in the way. You just hope there is nothing waiting for you around the corner.

Relief, disappointment.#
It is just another dead end.#

In front of you just a vertical rock wall, with a long, jagged fissure running from top to bottom.#
As if two massive slabs of rock collided dead on, leaving no space between to squeeze through.

Three paths, including the one you just came from, depart from in front the entrance to a tunnel.#

You hear a growling sound from the darkness of the tunnel.#
More oxies decided they'd have a go at you.
nodes.alttext: You recognize this place, were you fought the oxies at the tunnel entrance.

encounter.victoryMessage: You got rid of the oxies.
encounter.defeatMessage:
You lost.##
These oxies were too strong for you.

nodes.text: Three paths, including the one you just came from, depart from a small opening in front of the entrance to a tunnel.
nodes.alttext: Three paths depart from a small opening in front of the entrance to a tunnel.

nodes.text:
For some reason you felt the need to dive into the dark crevice.#
You carefully make your way inside the rock for a few minutes.#
Eventually, the passage opens up into a wider, albeit small, chamber.#
You don't have time to do much sight-seeing, as you hear $Mthings$C skittering from several directions.
nodes.alttext: This was the dead-end cave with some Croeggs in it. Go back.

encounter.victoryMessage:
You got rid of the...# insects?.#

You take a minute to look around.# Quite the nice crib they had here.#
Daylight seeps through tiny cracks and crevasses somewhere up above, allowing you to see without much trouble.#
Stalactites and stalagmites populate what you can't help thinking of as the late critters' living room.#
A small pool of bluish water adds ambience to the place.# Not a bad fixture for a desert dwelling.#

The place is also a dead end, so you head back.
encounter.defeatMessage: The giant centipedes got the best of you.## EWW!!#

nodes.text:
Another small clearing connecting gorges opens up in front of you.#
Before you can pick a direction, you need to get rid of the oxies here too.
nodes.alttext: Another fork in the way were you got ambushed by some oxies.

encounter.victoryMessage:
Will there ever be an end to this?#
They aren't going to go extinct because of you, right??
encounter.defeatMessage: You all just became the new favorite Oxies' meal.

nodes.text: Pick a direction.
There is a smooth wall in front of you, where three gorges converge.
Another dead end. Turn back.
Another dead end. Turn back.
You reach a spot where the gorge dies against two tunnels openings in opposite directions.

You turn the corner around the boulders, only to spot a massive Oxie sleeping on the ground.#
It is almost cute.# Almost.#

You start to think about sneaking past it, when its gross-looking snout twitches.#
Soon after,# its eyes snap open wide,# and growling and drooling it launches at you.
nodes.alttext: This was the place where you fought the big frenzied Oxie. Now pick a direction.

encounter.victoryMessage: Now that was quite the fight! Well done, I suppose.
encounter.defeatMessage: This beefy predator was maybe a bit too hyped for you.

nodes.text: This was the place where you fought the big, frenzied Oxie. Now pick a direction.

choices.desc: Crawl into the tunnel to the East.

nodes.text:
Another choice. Maybe you should have brought a coin or something...#
By the way, are you keeping track of your path?

choices.desc: Enter the tunnel to the left.

nodes.text:
You proceed through the semi-darkness of the narrow tunnel. Everything is quiet and the air is cold and damp.#
Soon enough a wider chambers opens up in front of you.#
Cave formations everywhere, you can hear the sporadic sound of dripping water.#
It's all nice and cool, but there's nowhere to go.# Turn back.

You proceed through the dark passage.#
Soon enough, you start to feel there must be something different about this cave.#

You can't exactly tell what it is,#
maybe a different, subtle smell,#
or the way the rock walls wind around the place,#
or the skittering noises coming from no specific direction.##

You continue for a while, until the path widens gradually into a larger cavern.#
It is quite large, and light comes in from the ceiling in multiple places somehow.#
There are many cave formations around, and you notice...# $MSTUFF...$C##
...some cluster-like material...# growing?...# around and against the stalagmites rising from the ground.#
It looks like...# Cobwebs?# Fungi?##

Your xenobiology musings are cut short by a shrill, shrieking cry,# suddenly echoing all around you.#
Your blood curdles as goosebumps form over your neck and spine.#

Everybody draws their weapons.# It seems you stepped into a Croegg nest!#
An unspecified number of insectoid creatures of all sizes come swarming at you from all directions!
nodes.alttext: This was the central hall of the main cavern, where you found the Croegg's nest.

encounter.victoryMessage: You defeated the swarm...# Trashing the place in the process.

nodes.text:
Now you have time to look around: the place is even larger than you first thought.#
Surely it must be some important portion of these centipede guys' colony.#
You shudder wondering if reinforcements are coming.#

There are, in total, 5 tunnels branching away in different directions.#

In the meantime, Smiurl is picking up some of that stuff growing around the place.# You do not dare ask why.#
nodes.alttext: This was the central hall of the main cavern, where you found the Croegg's nest.

nodes.text:
The passage continues for a while, cracks, and tiny openings everywhere.#
Nothing comes out of them, thankfully.#

Eventually, the passage itself becomes too narrow for a human to continue.# Not even Smiurl could.#
Nor he would,# it seems,# understandably.

You come to stand at the entrance of a cave.#
You feel the contrast between the heat of the desert air and the colder, damp air of the cave.

You stand inside a vestibule of sort, under a stone archway.#
There are two tunnels departing from here, or you can walk in the open.

choices.desc: Enter the tunnel to the West.
Enter the tunnel to the North.
Walk down the gorge to the East.

nodes.text:
You get to a junction where two gorges meet at an almost perfect right angle, like a crossroads.#

A scuffling you got used to by now comes from...# everywhere.#
It seems some oxies decided to ambush you from all four sides.
nodes.alttext: This was that crossroads-shaped junction where you fought four oxies.

nodes.text: This was that crossroads-shaped junction where you fought four oxies.
You reach the center of a T-shaped junction.

The walls here get higher and the width of the passage narrows.#
Looking up, you spot what looks like clay lumps stuck to the rock walls.#
They aren't very noticeable, as they are the same color as the rock, but something drew your attention to them.#

You realize they are not a geological accident, rather something intentional.#
Just as the word "nest" crosses your mind, several of their inhabitants pop their heads out and stare at you.#
Three of the bigger ones come swiftly down at you.
nodes.alttext: This was the passage with the Skarnyx nests.

nodes.text: This was the passage with the Skarnyx nests.
You reach a dead end. Turn back.
You reach a fork in the path.

choices.desc: Enter the tunnel to the right.

nodes.text:
Another dead end. Only a huge pile of rock that you are not going to try and climb.#

As you turn back, two Skarnyx leap at you from the shadows.
nodes.alttext: This was that dead end where you fought the Skarnyx. Go back.

nodes.text: Pick a direction.

choices.desc: Enter the tunnel to the left.

nodes.text: Another narrow junction where four passages meet. Pick a direction.
Just another dead end. Turn back.

In the middle of a T-junction, several Skarnyx are intent on picking a dead animal clean, probably an Oxie.#

They realize there's fresh food coming, and they shift their attention to you.
nodes.alttext: Here you fought the Skarnyx after interrupting their meal.

nodes.text: Here you fought the Skarnyx after interrupting their meal.
A fork in the path.

The path ends in front of a hole in the ground.#
It is pitch black and you cannot see anything inside, nor tell how deep it is.#
Better turn back.

The passage ends abruptly after a bend in front of a smooth high stone wall.#
Can't climb that.#
Turn back.

The passage gets narrower, to the point where you have to walk in a single file.#
Then, unexpectedly, it opens up into a wide clearing.##

Suddenly everything falls quiet.# I mean,# QUIETER.#
It seems nothing is moving around here, not even the air.#
No birds whatsoever to be spotted overhead, nor croaking out any of their calls.##

You all look at each other, somehow $Mknowing$C what is about to happen.##
As a single unit, you all ready your weapons,# slowly,# quietly.#
And just as you do,# a massive Oxie, at least twice the size of the others you've seen so far,#
comes out of the shadows.#
It is covered in scars and old wounds, and its eyes burn with a fierce, intelligent rage.#
It walks towards you slowly, deliberately, without any hint of fear.##

It must be the leader of the pack.#
You can kinda appreciate its feline elegance and its impressive, muscular poise.#
And it is not happy about your presence here.#
Or,# rather,# it IS happy finally some fresh meat has come its way.#
nodes.alttext: You defeated the Oxies' leader here.

encounter.victoryMessage:
You take a few minutes to catch your breath.##
It finally went down.# That wasn't easy.#
Your relief is partially overshadowed by the sorrow of having to slay such a powerful and doubtlessly intelligent creature.#
You wonder if the local fauna will ever stop wanting to having you for dinner.##

Probably not.
encounter.defeatMessage:
You did your best... I guess.#
The Oxie Leader was just too much for you.

nodes.text:
As you resume making your way through the Mazerock,#
that threatening feeling you had before suddenly comes back,#
nagging at the corners of your mind.#

Nothing really changed around you,# yet you feel things are somehow... different.#
As if the rocks and desert scrub around you could be more...## hostile?##

You try to shake off the feeling,# inanimate things cannot harbor ill intentions towards you.##
...right??##

You turn towards the two telepaths, and right then Efeliah stops in her tracks, eyes open wide.##
She and Math both look as they are listening to something only them can hear.#

You are about to ask them what is going on,# when for the first time you see fear spread on Ef's face.##
She instinctively grabs Math's arm,# and while still staring into the void she screams at all of you:#

$g"RUN!## NOW!"#$C
